title: Säkerhetsskyddshandläggare till Sweco!
description:
Har du en bakgrund inom säkerhetskydd och vill ha ett jobb som gör skillnad? Till Sweco som är en helhetsleverantör av tjänster inom säkerhet och skydd, söker vi nu en Säkerhetskyddshandläggare! Läs mer om tjänsten här och skicka in en ansökan redan idag.
 



  

**Företag :**
 SWECO Sverige AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 HR/kontor/administration
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 För Swecos räkning söker vi nu en säkerhetsskyddshandläggare med betoning på säkerhetsprövningar med placering vid deras huvudkontor på Kungsholmen i Stockholm. Avdelningen består av en säkerhetsskyddschef tillika säkerhetschef, en biträdande säkerhetsskyddschef samt två säkerhetsskyddshandläggare.
 


  


 Som säkerhetsskyddshandläggare hos Sweco kommer du få stora möjligheter att utvecklas både personlighets- intresse- och erfarenhetsmässigt, i ett bolag som ständigt utvecklas. Här får du möjlighet att vara en del av företagets arbete med att bistå Swecos kunder i att skydda viktiga funktioner i samhället. Hos Sweco blir du del av ett starkt team som kompletterar och ställer upp för varandra i verksamheten.
 


  


 Tjänsten är ett bemanningsuppdrag via Academic Work som förväntas pågå långsiktigt förutsatt att samarbetet fungerar bra.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Genomföra och följa upp säkerhetsprövningar
  
* Genomföra personutredningar vid särskilda händelser
  
* Administration i form av säkerhetsskyddsavtal, bakgrundskontroller, ansökan om registerkontroller, utbildningar m.m.
  
* Utveckla, driva och säkerhetställa att säkerhetsskyddet i Sweco efterlevs
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad universitetsutbildning inom säkerhet, beteendevetenskap, IT eller liknande
  
* Har intresse för system, IT och säkerhet
  
* Har lätt för att sätta dig in i nya system och arbetssätt
  
* Har mycket goda kunskaper i både svenska och engelska då bägge språken används i det dagliga arbetet
  
* Har erfarenhet av arbete inom säkerhetsskydd
  
* Har säkerhetsbakgrund av något slag exempelvis informationssäkerhet, personalsäkerhet eller om du studerat på eftergymnasial nivå inom ämnet
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Stabil
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  


 I den här processen kommer dina personliga egenskaper vara avgörande. För att lyckas i tjänsten är bör du vara driven, trygg, pålitlig och ha hög integritet. Vidare är du noggrann, kvalitetsmedveten och har en välutvecklad analytisk förmåga. Du behöver även ha en god kommunikativ- och pedagogisk förmåga, vilket gör att du skapar förtroende och förståelse till våra medarbetare. För dig är det viktigt att driva uppgifter framåt och i mål.
 


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 


  


 Går du vidare i processen kommer bakgrundskontroller genomföras som en del av rekryteringsprocessen.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Alina Finnberg eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stn01@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105313

title: Take the Helm – Onnec seeks a Site Manager!
description:
Onnec Group aims to be the heart of cONNECtions and is now looking for an experienced and skilled Site Manager to coordinate their projects within data networks, fiber optics, and copper infrastructure.
 


  


 As a Site Manager at Onnec, you will be responsible for overseeing daily operations and working closely with the Project Manager. You will be part of a young and dynamic work environment with a flat hierarchy, providing an opportunity to contribute to the company's development.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 ONNEC Sweden AB
 



  

**City :**
 Stockholm/Gävle/Sandviken
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Onnec Group is a leading network solutions provider and global technology partner. With over 30 years of experience Onnec is offering data center services and computer management solutions and is currently on an exciting growth journey. While operating in a rapidly growing data center market, Onnec is providing services and installations to various data center operators in the Nordic region. There are many opportunities for development and the company has a streamlined decision-making process. Despite having over 30 years of industry experience, the business in Sweden is still young, with the ambition to grow even further.
 


  


 As a Site Manager, you will be responsible for ensuring smooth daily operations, overseeing projects regarding data network, fiber optics, and copper projects. We are seeking someone with a proven track record in dealing with issues regarding drilling and understanding potential problems that may arise. You will be ensuring quality in the daily work and maintaining daily contact with suppliers. Your role will include being the right-hand person to the project manager.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* **A dedicated consultant manager and career partner**
  
* **An expanding market and opportunities for global growth.**
  


  


 As a Site Manager at Onnec you will take part in exciting projects and there is potential for international assignments as well, including work in the United States or Italy.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Administrative support including for example conducting risk management and analysis
  
* Support the project manager in health and safety inspections
  
* Monitoring the technical work and contractors as well as colleagues
  
* Organizing and coordinating internal reporting
  
* Ongoing contact with suppliers and contractors
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Previous experience of working within the
   

**data center industry**
 , preferably with installations
  
* Fluent speaking in
   

**English**
  
* A good understanding of
   

**cabling installation practices**
  
* Previous experience as a
   

**Project Engineer / Site Manager**
 within the data center industry
  


  


 For this role we are looking for someone who is willing to learn and eager to grow. As a Site Manager you are driven, organized, and reliable.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Malla Söderberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on malla.soderberg@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105423

title: Payroll Consultant
description:
**We have a exciting vacancy for a Payroll Consultant!**
**LOCATION:** 
**Östermalmstorg 1, 114 42 Stockholm, Sweden**
**Hybrid working – 3 days in office and 2 days from home**
**In this role, you will** 
 serve as ADP's front-line for solving clients' challenges, including issue resolution, answering questions, helping clients, and more. You carry the weight of ADP’s service reputation and client satisfaction in your hands.
   

  

 You will identify, improve and follow specific processes and routines to maximize the efficiency of the business. Ensures correct information regarding salary payments, holiday debt, tax return and year-end routines.
   

  

 Has a very good sense of customer service and a consultative approach and is stimulated by new challenges. Actively contributes to the development and profitability of the business.
   

  

 This role reports to the Team Manager.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Provides payroll processing and support to our customers within the correct time frame/deadline.
* Has good knowledge of the company's applications (Hogia payroll, Flex HRM, PBM, Tulip, etc.) to prepare routines and reports.
* Contact person for their customers and builds good relationships.
* Follow the ISO documentation.
* Always maintain a high level of service and keep all information confidential.
* Follows laws and agreements and guides customers.
* Have good knowledge of our partners and working methods and train consultants if necessary.
* Have sufficient knowledge of our customers' contracts and prices for invoicing and is responsible for ensuring that the correct time and services are charged for own work.
* Has own area of responsibility to run processes/projects independently (functional responsibility) to achieve the project goal on time.
* Proactive planning and correct execution for their customers and responsible for materials from the customer arriving on time.
* Be able to provide support and guide consultants in parts of the payroll process and routines.
* If necessary, be a supervisor for new hires/juniors and interns, set up a schedule and follow up throughout the period.
* Keeps up to date on customers' collective agreements and correct handling.
* Quality assurance over the payroll process and reports.
* Correct handling of salary type updates/connections.
* Have a creative problem-solving approach, independently able to solve problems directly with the customer.
* Be able to summarize conclusions and recommendations towards the customer and within the business for improvement to development and streamlining.


**To Succeed In This Role**
* Education: Qualified vocational education/SALK/Further education
* Hogia Salary Plus
* Good knowledge in English
* Special system/program: Expertise in at least two payroll systems, autonomous in the entire payroll process
* Degree from practical payroll training or equivalent
* Continuous training in salary rules, taxes, holidays, laws and contracts
* Good knowledge of pre-systems, Hogia Lön Plus, Flex HRM
* Microsoft 365, Excel
* High integrity
* GDPR


**Benefits**
* Pension scheme
* Hybrid working
* Paid study support
* 30 days holiday
* Private medical


**You'll Love Working Here Because You Can**
* Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights.
* Belong by joining one of ten Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences.
* Grow your career in an agile, dynamic environment with plenty of opportunities to progress.
* Continuously learn through ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities.
* Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones.
* Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another.
* Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impactupon the communities in which we work and live.
* Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.


**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** 
 ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.
   

  

**Ethics at ADP:** 
 ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.

title: Application Integration Specialist
description:
*Benify is an international HR tech company that provides a market-leading global benefit and total rewards platform. With over 500 Benifyers in 6 countries, we're driving success with over 1500 customers and approximately two million users around the world* 
 🌍
 *. We empower people to be the best they can be while fostering a sustainable and engaging work culture where employees feel engaged and included* 
***"Because People Matter"***
 💙
 *.*
**Responsibilities**
 As an Application Integration Specialist, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and maintaining integrations that enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of our organization. You will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining integrations between different software systems, ensuring data consistency, accuracy, and reliability.
   

  

**As An Application Integration Specialist, You Will Also**
* Configure, customize, and develop integrations using the Benify platform, APIs, web services, integration tools (such as Node Red), and other cutting-edge technologies.
* Collaborate closely with developers, system administrators, and third-party vendors to ensure a smooth deployment of integrations
* Engage in data transfer scoping and implementation to ensure data consistency, accuracy, and reliability.
* Conduct thorough testing and troubleshooting of the solutions you build to guarantee optimal performance.
* Create comprehensive documentation for integrations, providing valuable insights for future reference.
* Share your expertise with team members through knowledge-sharing sessions, fostering a collaborative and learning-oriented environment


****Personal attributes****
 Success in this role hinges on your ability to collaborate effectively, demonstrating strong communication skills to articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Moreover, your success will be enhanced by your proactive approach, seizing opportunities to lead and foster positive change.
   

  

**We Also See That You Have**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* Fundamental understanding of Object-Oriented Programming
* Proficiency in integration technologies, APIs, web services, and messaging protocols (REST)
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, demonstrating the ability to diagnose and resolve complex integration issues


******I******
********t's a ⭐, thus not a requirement if you also got...********
* Familiarity with data formats such as XML, JSON, and CSV
* Experience with Node-Red or a similar Integration Tool
* Knowledge of data transformation and mapping techniques
* Understanding of project management methodologies


**Perks of being a Benifyer**
* Collective agreement 📝
* Generous wellness allowance 🏃‍♂️
* 30 day of vacation 🌞
* ITP1 Pension and Lifeplan - a pension tool that provides you with personalized advice to optimize your retirement planning 💸
* Guaranteed work-life balance with a hybrid work model 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦
* Annual conference ✈️
* A variety of social events and activities in the offices ✌️
* Workation- possibility to work abroad within EU 🌍
* You're responsible for your own development and we offer internal career opportunities 🚀


**Practical information**
**Start:** 
 As soon as we find the right fit! 🧐
   

  

**Extent:** 
 Full-time, 100%
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm or Gothenburg, Sweden.
   

  

 Apply by submitting your CV and/or your LinkedIn profile using the application form below. We screen applications continuously and may hire someone before the last application date.
   

  

*Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments for interviews by replying to the email you will receive after you apply.*
*****Due to summer vacation we will not be able to have interviews before middle of August. Thank you for your patience!*****
 Benify started in 2004 in Sweden with a goal to revolutionize the HR industry with a platform that would improve the lives of employees. Today, Benify is an independent, flexible, and agile global HR technology company, offering the market’s leading global benefits and total rewards platform.

title: Säkerhetskonsult inom Microsofts
description:
**Vi kan vara ditt nästa karriärsteg!**
 Din roll hos oss:
   

  

 Som säkerhetskonsult får du chansen att arbeta med några av Sveriges mest intressanta kunder och deras komplexa IT-miljöer. Du kommer att spela en central roll i att säkerställa och förbättra deras säkerhetslösningar inom Microsofts ekosystem.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete med Microsoft 365 eller Azure.
* Bakgrund inom compliance och informationssäkerhet.
* Grundläggande kunskaper om Azure, Power Platform och systemutveckling.
* Förståelse för molntjänster och Microsoft 365.
* Förmåga att kommunicera väl på svenska i både tal och skrift.


 För att lyckas i denna roll bör du vara en kommunikativ och driven individ som trivs med att lösa problem och som kan ta egna initiativ.
   

  

 Om B3 Cloud:
   

  

 Som experter på molnteknik och den digitala arbetsplatsen av morgondagen, hjälper vi våra kunder att transformera sin infrastruktur från traditionell till molnbaserad. Vi stödjer kunderna genom hela processen, från analys och planering till migrering och förvaltning. Vi är också en viktig del i att skapa en modern arbetsplats med Microsoft 365, och är stolta över att vara både Guldpartner och Cloud Service Provider (CSP) för Microsoft.
   

  

 På B3 Cloud är det viktigt att ha roligt på jobbet. Vi bygger en stark företagskultur med fokus på wellness, frihet och balans i livet. Vi erbjuder en attraktiv ersättningsmodell som ger stor frihet för allt från uppdrag till ledighet och kompetensutveckling.
   

  

 Intresserad? Känner du att denna roll skulle kunna vara ditt nästa karriärsteg? Skicka din ansökan idag! Har du frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Melinda på melinda.andersson@b3.se.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!**
*B3 Cloud är en del av B3-koncernen, utsedd till Sveriges tredje bästa arbetsplats 2021 av Great Place to Work och till Sveriges IT Karriärföretag 2022. Vi lever efter våra värdeord: erfarenhet, olikheter och energi. Vi jobbar för hållbarhet i alla led och tror att välmående medarbetare presterar bättre. Därför arrangerar vi regelbundna wellness-aktiviteter, från yoga och simning till musikquiz, stickcafé och föreläsningar om stress och mental hälsa."*

title: Project Controller - Solar parks
description:
The Utility business unit at Svea Solar is responsible for utility-scale (i.e.,
 *very* 
 large!) projects. We excel at the full-cycle process of developing, constructing, and managing solar energy projects that power the future.
   

  

 To ensure our EPC services projects' financial health and success, we are looking for a rigorous and commercially driven Project Controller to join the team.
   

  

**The role**
 You will be a part of the Utility Services business unit that provides EPC services in building and operating solar parks across Sweden. You will work closely with project managers, procurement, and other stakeholders to ensure projects are financially sound and risks are well-managed. In collaboration with the Group Finance functions, the role plays an active part in the overall FP&A processes of Svea Solar.
   

  

 In short, you will have full controlling responsibility for the department, but if you are looking for the good old bullet point list of "what will I actually do", here it is:
   

  

* Implement cost controls to ensure individual solar parks stay within budget.
* Develop and manage budgets, forecasts, profitability metrics, and financial plans to ensure short-term and long-term financial stability on a P&L and cash flow basis.
* Convert project data into P&L statements and report deviations.
* Coach and support project leaders in creating and following up on project finances and commercial aspects.
* Perform regular liquidity forecasting and perform financial analysis to identify variances between budgeted and actual expenditures.


**Are we a match?**
 We are looking for a methodical, reliable professional who drives positive change. If you excel in identifying root causes of deviations and enjoy challenging stakeholders constructively, we want to hear from you! We believe that these experiences and qualities will help you have a great start with the role:
   

  

* Several years of experience in project controlling or business controlling, preferably in construction or energy.
* Relevant educational background in Finance, Engineering or BA.
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling, financial analysis, and data analysis.
* Advanced Excel skills and other tools for analysis.
* A detail-oriented and rigorous approach to work.
* Strong analytical skills for thorough and granular analysis.
* The ability to partner with stakeholders to understand problems and find solutions.


**Application**
 Join us in the power shift towards a sustainable future! ☀️ You can apply with your LinkedIn profile, and we do not require a traditional CV or cover letter. We'll ask several questions in your application to help us understand your profile better.
 **Please apply by August 22nd.** 
 We review applications continuously, and the position might be closed before the last application date.
   

  

 Read more about our standard recruitment process: https://careers.sveasolar.com/pages/recruitment-process
   

  

**Diversity & Inclusion**
 Svea Solar believes that a diverse workplace leads to the creativity that’s necessary for the industry to keep on growing in a sustainable & innovative way. We welcome new co-workers from different backgrounds and experiences to represent the diversity of our community and customers.
   

  

**Background check**
 For all final candidates, we conduct background checks through a criminal record register.
   

  

**Feedback**
 Regardless of the recruitment process stage, all applicants will eventually receive a candidate survey. We value your feedback and constructive comments on how to improve our processes.
   

  

 Read more about working at Svea Solar: https://careers.sveasolar.com/

title: Group Procurement Category Manager, Services
description:
One of the worlds leading renewables companies is recruiting a new Group Category Manager, Services to join the team.
 



  





 The business has been on a bold and impressive expansion journey, doubling in size over the past ten years with international reach now.
 



  





 Reporting to the Category Lead, you will manage spends across a range of indirect categories including HR, Fleet, facilities, transport and some IT.
 



  





 You will be given the autonomy and flexibility to devise, implement and embed category strategies across the group and work with a range of business unit leaders to minimise risk, maximise efficiency's and reduce cost for the business.
 



  





 This is an excellent opportunity for someone that wants to step up in to a Category Manager role and take ownership over their portfolio and spend area.
 



  





 Responsibilities:
 


* Execute procurement procedures. Such as sourcing, RFx, negotiations, contracting, renewals, QBRs, supplier on/offboarding, both at group-level and local-level within the assigned Services categories.
* Together with relevant stakeholders and the Services Team, develop and implement the category strategy for existing or new products and/or services within the assigned categories.
* Consolidate, build, and present, together with the relevant stakeholders, decision material regarding the operational, tactical, and strategic matters within the Services categories.
* Manage the supplier portfolio within assigned categories, considering a wide variety of factors, such as vendor performance, quality, collaboration efficiency, sustainability, risks, and costs.



  





 They are looking for someone that:
 


* can run end to end procurement processes
* can build robust relationships with stakeholders and suppliers
* Has a background in indirects
* Can speak English to professional professional



  





 Benefits:
 



 - Competitive salary
 



 - Wellness benefit
 



 - Holiday
 



 - Company perks and benefits

title: Marketing Channel Delivery Manager
description:
**Marketing Channel Delivery Manager, EU Cluster Markets**
**Job Description**
**Role Purpose:**
* This role will be responsible for supporting Channel Delivery service activities within EU Cluster markets. The Marketing Channel Delivery Manager role will closely collaborate with the Marketing Channel Delivery EU Clusters Lead, BUs, BOPs, Digital, and Channel Teams to develop digital strategies and goals that meet needs of HCP and Patients ensuring adherence with Global standards, compliance, legal and business requirements, on time and to budget.


 In particular, the Marketing Channel Delivery manager will be focus on:
   

  

* Campaign Management capabilities through execution of outbound (eMail) marketing programs.
* HCP Portal to engage customers with promotional messaging, and/or access additional Pfizer products and services. Advise marketing teams on how to structure and implement a successful portal strategy to enhance the customer experience. Portal governance and above brand oversight.
* ePermission governance to support customer acquisition strategy (collection, management, data quality and reporting)
* Manage and oversight of Omnichannel reporting to measure omnichannel performance and guarantee KPIs consistency across Global standard dashboard.
* Rollout, oversight and scale of Social 2-way Communications capabilities ensuring process execution, compliance, and efficiency
* Provide a robust Samples Management service, ensuring compliance and efficiency


**Main Role responsibilities** 
 :
   

  

* Responsible for the day-to-day operations and management of omnichannel service providers and ensures on-time delivery across channels and campaigns.
* Demonstrate to internal customers the value of Marketing Channel Delivery services and drive positive customer satisfaction through results.
* Working with enabling functions to ensure delivery of global / local omnichannel and content deployment plans.
* Ensure all relevant local approvals and compliance standards and practices are met.
* Serve as local expert to advise omnichannel teams on how to structure and implement a successful omnichannel strategy to enhance the customer experience.
* Directs the development and delivery of measurable campaign plans for the BU that deliver maximum value across customer touch points and journeys, ensuring adherence to omnichannel standards and compliance requirements
* Enable efficient & effective global to local digital content production
* Enable operational metrics aligned with commercial effectiveness strategy guidance


**Qualifications**
* BA Required; MBA or equivalent Master's-level education preferred
* Demonstrate passion for digital and innovation
* 3+ years digital marketing or equivalent experience in pharmaceutical sector is preferred
* Influence and communications skills - ability to generate credibility
* Team working, decision making and up-to-date knowledge on digital trends and best practices
* Ability to work with metrics and KPIs to evaluate and optimize the digital performance
* Demonstrated agility and ability to independently drive program completion


 Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.
   

  

 Disability Inclusion
   

  

 Our mission is unleashing the power of all our people and we are proud to be a disability inclusive employer, ensuring equal employment opportunities for all candidates. We encourage you to put your best self forward with the knowledge and trust that we will make any reasonable adjustments to support your application and future career. Your journey with Pfizer starts here!
   

  

 Marketing and Market Research

title: Product Marketing Manager, Platform Ecosystem
description:
Acronis is a world leader in cybersecurity and data protection—empowering people by providing them with cutting-edge technology that enables them to monitor, control, and protect the data that their businesses and lives depend on. We are in an exciting phase of rapid-growth and expansion and looking for a Product Marketing Manager who is ready to join us in creating a #CyberFit future and protecting the digital world
   

  

 Every member of our “A-Team” has an instrumental role and impact on the success of Acronis’ innovative and growing business, so we are looking for someone who enjoys working in dynamic, global teams and thrives in a fast-paced and rapidly changing work environment. Just like everyone at Acronis, the ideal candidate will embody all of our company values: responsive, alert, detail-oriented, makes decisions, and never gives up.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
 As part of our Product and Solutions Marketing organization, you will be reporting to the Director of Product Marketing. In this global role you will support and execute our product marketing and launch plans, coordinate joint marketing motions with Acronis' partners, ensure Acronis' presence in external and internal marketplaces, and drive the Technology Partner Program and GTM execution for Acronis’ Platform. You will:
   

  

* Be a key player on our product marketing team for our platform solutions. You will oversee and coordinate different related projects to ensure they benefit one another, aligned with the strategy and business goals defined in the Acronis Platform GTM strategy.
* Be a key partner to our Platform Partner Core Team leads. You will work closely with the cross-functional core team leads from Sales, Product Marketing and Product Management coordinating and implementing changes to the Acronis Technology Partner Program to drive its success.
* Coordinate and execute a marketing plan for the Acronis Platform. Working with marcom and partner marketing managers cross-functionally, you'll coordinate and execute a comprehensive marketing plan including joint activities with Acronis partners - offering a single view to everything needed to bring the Acronis Platform to market - and then report back on the results.
* Help keep Acronis Solutions Marketplace and external partner marketplaces updated. You will help ensure that new solutions are published on time and presented in the best way in the Acronis Marketplace and external third-party marketplaces. You will drive and coordinate content reviews and reciprocal promotions in the marketplaces.
* You'll use our processes and tools like Jira and SharePoint to track your work and collaborate with our team.


**What You Bring (experience & Qualifications)**
* 5+ years of product marketing experience within the B2B IT industry, with time at an established high-tech company.
* Experience creating, managing and executing joined partner marketing activities and managing partner programs.
* Experience working with Managed Service Providers, Cloud Marketplaces, and/or product integrations is a plus.
* Experience working across tech and business teams, representing the voice of the partner, and finding creative ways to engage and get feedback from the partners.
* High energy and enthusiasm – the type that is contagious with its potential.
* Some travel to events and meetings, including to international locations, may be required but is expected to be under 10-15% and in accordance with company health and safety policies.
* English fluency with exceptional written, verbal, and presentation creation skills required.


**Who We Are**
 Acronis is revolutionizing cyber protection by unifying backup, disaster recovery, storage, next-generation anti-malware, and protection management into one solution. This all-in-one integration removes the complexity and risks associated with non-integrated solutions and offers easy, complete and reliable data protection for all workloads, applications, and systems across any environment—all at a low and predictable cost.
   

  

 Founded in Singapore in 2003 and incorporated in Switzerland in 2008, Acronis now has more than 2,000 employees and offices in 34 locations worldwide. Its solutions are trusted by more than 5.5 million home users and 500,000 companies, and top-tier professional sports teams. Acronis products are available through over 50,000 partners and service providers in over 150 countries and 26 languages.
   

  

 Our corporate culture is focused on making a positive impact on the lives of each employee and the communities in which we live. Mutual trust, respect, personal achievement, individual leadership, and a belief that we can contribute to the world everyday are the cornerstones of the Acronis Team.
   

  

 Acronis is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, medical condition, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: Servicevärd
description:
*Var 660:e person som går till arbetet i Sverige är en ISS-medarbetare och det är vi stolta över. Vi är ett av Sveriges och Nordens största tjänsteföretag samt har över 450 000 medarbetare världen över. Det är våra medarbetare som är kärnan i vår verksamhet och förutsättningen för att kunna leva upp till vårt syfte, Connecting people and places to make the world work better. På ISS Facility Services skapar vi platser och miljöer som bidrar till bättre prestationer och en enklare, mer effektiv och trivsam tillvaro - levererade med omtanke och hög kvalitet av engagerade medarbetare. Vill du också bli en del i vår globala organisation där ditt jobb verkligen gör skillnad?*
**Om rollen**
 I rollen som servicevärd blir du kundens ansikte utåt och får därmed en mycket viktig roll i att skapa ett välkomnande och professionellt mottagande, både externt och internt. Din uppgift är att se till att kontorets tjänsteleverans fungerar smidigt och att upplevelsen av kontor och lokaler ska förmedla en helhetsupplevelse av en säker, attraktiv, modern och hållbar arbetsplats som kundens medarbetare trivs i och tycker om.
   

  

**Exempel på arbetsuppgifter**
 Arbetsuppgifterna är i huvudsak att ta ansvar för helhetsservicen på kontoret. Du tar emot besökare, sköter om kaffemaskiner, har ett helhetsansvar för konferensrum, skrivarrum där papper fylls på löpande. Du hanterar inkommande ärenden per telefon och mail, sköter hantering av taxikort med mera. Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med två andra servicevärdar där ni har rullande scheman för att säkerställa ett varierat arbetssätt.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Vi söker dig som är mycket social, hjälpsam, positiv och som uppskattar ett omväxlande arbete. Du är självständig, proaktiv och initiativtagande, du ser vad som behöver göras och gör det! Du är inte rädd för att ta personlig kontakt, men kan också avgöra hur och när du lämpligast gör det. Du trivs i rollen som företagsrepresentant och delar ISS vilja att leverera service i världsklass.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du har erfarenhet av liknande arbetsuppgifter, gärna som receptionist, kontorsvärdinna/värd eller liknande men din personlighet väger tyngre. Du trivs med att fatta egna beslut och har en god organisatorisk förmåga. Då kundens internationella koncernspråk är engelska är det ett krav att du behärskar det engelska och svenska språket i både tal och skrift. Flera av våra inkommande ärenden är IT-relaterade, därför är det av yttersta vikt att du har både kompetens och intresse för dessa frågor.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder en varierande och spännande roll där ditt arbete kommer vara en viktig del i att nå ISS och kundens mål. Du blir en representant för ISS och även ett ansikte utåt för kunden. ISS är en global organisation med stort fokus på utveckling för såväl medarbetare som för kunden. Inom ISS organisation finns goda möjligheter till utveckling inom brett varierande områden.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på 100% med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Provanställning tillämpas. Placeringsort är Stockholm
   

  

 Vid frågor om tjänsten kontakta driftchef sofie.tarnrot@se.issworld.com
   

  

**Observera!** 
 Vi tar ej emot ansökningar via mejl utan enbart via vårt rekryteringssystem. Du ansöker genom att gå in på vår hemsida www.se.issworld.com /jobba hos oss/se våra lediga jobb och registrera ditt CV. Ansökningar som skickas på annat sätt kommer inte att kunna besvaras eller hanteras för den här rekryteringen.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Sr. GTM Specialist GenAI Europe-North
description:
**Description**
 Are you a customer-obsessed builder with a passion for helping customers achieve their full potential? Do you have the business savvy, Data Analytics background, and sales skills necessary to help position AWS as the cloud provider of choice for customers? Do you love building new strategic and data-driven businesses? Join the Worldwide Specialist Organization (WWSO) Data and AI team as a Business Development Specialist!
   

  

 The Worldwide Specialist Organization (WWSO) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector. We work backwards from our customer’s most complex and business critical problems to build and execute go-to-market plans that turn AWS ideas into multi-billion-dollar businesses. WWSO teams include business development, specialist and technical solutions architecture. As part of WWSO, you'll provide expertise across the entire life cycle of an AWS customer initiative, from developing ideas for new services to accelerating the adoption of established businesses. We pride ourselves on thinking big, delivering exceptional results for our customers, and working across AWS as #OneTeam.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

 Own the GTM strategy and execution for GenAI Domain as part of the Data and AI Pillar for Europe-North (Benelux, Nordics, Baltics), collaborating with teams in the field including Sales, Partners, Marketing, and other Specialists.
   

  

 Leverage your deep expertise in analytics to understand the most important customer problems in your region and enable account aligned teams in the field to solve them.
   

  

 Lead cross-functional initiatives to expand markets/accounts, develop scalable programs to drive adoption, and identify new opportunities within your domain.
   

  

 Develop and execute goals to drive long term growth in your geography, while meeting/exceeding revenue and non-revenue driven KPI’s.
   

  

* Bring customer data and market signals back to Worldwide teams to ensure we are prioritizing the building of the right features and services for our customers.


 Delivering monthly/quarterly business reviews and operational planning documents for your respective tech domain and geography.
   

  

 Drive geographical scale through external partners; Partner with cross functional teams across Solution Architecture, Business Development, Marketing, Partners, and Training and execute customer acquisition programs and strategies.
   

  

 A day in the life
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Within WWSO, this position is a part of the Go-To-Market (GTM) Specialist team, where you will lead GTM strategy for AWS’ GenAI for Europe-North. We create sales plays, leverage partners, and build new initiatives that drive results for our customers. We provide critical feedback from customers to inform our product roadmap, and work closely with our partner network to build an ecosystem supporting our customers’ goals. In emerging areas, we play a critical role as the “first in” teams to build markets for new services, domains, or solutions. When a customer needs to innovate and requires a new way to leverage AWS, they count on us to innovate with them to build and deliver what they need.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* 7+ years of relevant GTM, Sales, or Consulting experience
* 5+ years of technology domain experience in AI/ML domain


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Exceptional interpersonal and communication (both written and verbal) skills with experience communicating to technical and non-technical audiences.
* Established track record of credibility as a technology advisor with customer executives (e.g. CEO, COO, CIO, CTO, CMO) and Line of Business Leaders.
* Experience and success in negotiating complex deals with customers and partners.
* Experience in a heavily matrixed sales environment, including developing, implementing, managing, and executing go-to-market growth initiatives and sales motions.
* Deep understanding of cloud technologies, including public and hybrid cloud platforms.
* Technical background in engineering, computer science, or MIS a plus.


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch) - G54
   

  

 Job ID: A2693151

title: Graduate Construction Cost Manager
description:
**Overview**
 As a
 **Graduate Construction Cost Manager** 
 at Linesight , you will work with highly experienced, culturally diverse, and passionate teams nurturing a strong social dynamic and a shared sense of achievement. You will gain vast industry experience that will open doors for you, extend your skillset and expand your perspective. We will empower, support, and enable you to take real responsibility in your role so that you can take charge of your career progression with us. For us lasting trusted relationships are everything, both with our teams and our clients.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
**In This Role You Will**
* Join one of Sweden team in Stockholm and gain hands-on experience working in exciting, innovative sectors with some of the world’s most prestigious companies
* Actively participate in the tender/bid process--from initial tender/bid documentation through analysis and reporting
* Attend site meetings & design team meetings
* Gain knowledge of estimating and life cycle costing
* Help oversee project spend by creating valuations and cost reports, and clearly communicate variations to your team
* Learn more about bill of quantities and sub-contract packages
* Support nimble project management and clear decisions through excellent cost documentation and timely communication
* Engage in a range of learning and fun events that will help you connect with other disciplines within the organisation, build a network and make some friends!


**We Would Love To Hear From You If You**
* Have ideally completed a Bachelors or higher qualification in Quantity Surveying & Construction Economics or Construciton Management or Other relevant construcition related qualification.
* Have a strong desire to progress your career within Cost Management in the Construction industry
* Have lots of initiative and a hunger to learn and grow your career
* Strive to work in a team supporting clients on complex, large-scale construction projects
* Have the legal right to work in Sweden and speak English fluently, Swedish languate is an advantage


**About Us**
 Linesight is a highly successful global project and cost management consultancy that keeps clients coming back. And for that we have our people to thank. You see we’re not like the others. We’re different. Unique. It’s our fresh thinking and focus on what matters that has led to our evolving. We are on a journey working in some of the most exciting innovative sectors with some of the world’s most prestigious companies delivering major projects that deliver a more sustainable built environment. We have an open culture and a flat structure where you can expect to be treated with genuine care, respect, and empathy. With Linesight, you can truly discover the power of team!
   

  

 Diversity, inclusion and accessibility
   

  

 Linesight is committed to transparent, equal opportunity employment practices. We are building a diverse and inclusive organisation, accessible to all, based on having a safe culture which enables all our people to be their true selves. We are a people business, and we understand that the more inclusive we are, the happier our people and better our work will be. We will ensure that individuals with disability are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the application or recruitment process and are accommodated in the workplace. If you require assistance or accommodation of any kind, please mention this in your application, we would love to hear from you!

title: Objektspecialist-HR till Järfälla kommun!
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Järfälla kommun är en av de kommuner som växer mest inom Storstockholm. Det tycker vi är väldigt spännande! Vi tycker om att göra saker tillsammans med verksamheterna, för det är så det blir skillnad för våra medborgare och medarbetare. Nu söker vi en objektsspecialist inom HR som ska fortsätta vårt utvecklingsarbete. Vill du vara med på vår resa? Vi tror att du som har ett utvecklingsdriv och ett stort engagemang inom HR i kombination med kunskap inom IT-system som stödjer verksamheten kommer trivas som fisken i vattnet hos oss. Vi är innovativa och förändringsbenägna och där kommer du in, vi ska ju fortsätta utvecklas! Du kommer vara en del av HR-avdelningen på kommunstyrelseförvaltningen. Här finns 11 HR-konsulter/strateger men också ett gäng lönespecialister och två systemförvaltare inom lön. Din roll blir en viktig brygga mellan de två enheterna (HR och Lön) och du kommer att arbeta tätt ihop med systemförvaltarna. Utöver det har du en nära dialog med IT som också finns där för att hjälpa dig, och det finns även stöd från andra funktioner på förvaltningarna.
   

  

 Vi finns till för våra kommuninvånare och vi arbetar tillsammans för att klara framtidens utmaningar oavsett vilken funktion vi har. Trivs du i en samverkande roll där HR möter teknik? Då är detta tjänsten för dig.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som objektsspecialist inom HR utgör du en viktig kugge i vårt maskineri. Du kommer att vara kontaktytan gentemot alla våra verksamheter och arbeta tätt med våra förvaltningar och med HR. En del av ditt uppdrag blir att se till att HR når de mål vi sätter upp. Du kommer att ansvara för daglig systemadministration vilket gör att du behöver ha en djup kunskap om IT-stödets funktioner. I dagsläget arbetar vi med Opus, Novi, Stella, Hypergene och Benify. Du driver utveckling, förvaltar och följer upp HR- systemen samt kommunens arbete med HR-system tillsammans med övriga objektspecialister, superanvändare och förvaltningsledaren för IT.
   

  

 Uppdraget innebär nära samverkan med leverantörer av verksamhetssystem och HR-system, Järfällas IT-enhet och såklart med dina kollegor inom HR.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att:
   

  

* Se till att våra HR-system stödjer kommunens HR-processer på ett effektivt och användarvänligt sätt
* Ansvara för löpande systemförvaltning, samt för underhåll och utveckling av våra system som hanterar de flesta HR-processer i kommunen, såsom rehabilitering, systematiskt arbetsmiljöarbete, personalstatistik och lärande
* Administrera behörigheter och roller i de olika systemen
* Testa nya versioner och koordinera uppgraderingar av systemen
* Arbeta i olika projekt, så småningom upphandling av nya system
* Ta fram statistik och rapporter
* Leda vårt forum för HR inom Hypergene, där vi arbetar med vår styrmodell. Det gör att du också är med och utvecklar och kvalitetssäkrar system och funktioner, samt agerar utbildare för vår gemensamma HR-funktion
* Utveckla och uppdatera användardokumentation
* Leda och delta i möten avseende systemen
* Utbilda användare av systemen.


 Eftersom du är en del av HR-avdelningen på central nivå rapporterar du direkt till HR-direktör.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 I den här rekryteringen söker vi dig som antingen är en utpräglad HR-person med intresse och kunskap inom systemförvaltning. Eller så är du en systemförvaltare som fascineras av HR-spåret och har kunskap inom det. Vi vill att du har en relevant akademisk utbildning inom HR/System eller kompetens som kan anses som likvärdig från arbetslivserfarenhet.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har kunskaper inom lagar och kollektivavtal samt en förståelse för hur digitalisering av HR-processer kan användas inom verksamheten. Vi vill också att du har mycket goda kunskaper i det svenska språket (i både tal och skrift).
   

  

 Har du dessutom arbetat inom kommunal verksamhet tidigare är det meriterande, likväl som om du har erfarenhet av projektledning, att driva och leda processutveckling samt att agera beställare.
   

  

 Rollen passar dig som har ett självständigt och strukturerat arbetssätt samt förmågan att ta egna initiativ. Vidare är du pedagogisk lagd och har god kommunikationsförmåga. Du har lätt för att samarbeta och ser vikten av goda relationer såväl inom som utanför den egna verksamheten. Du kan lyfta blicken för att se helheten samtidigt som du kan hantera detaljfrågor för att lösa problem som uppstår. Det kan gå snabbt i våra verksamheter ibland och vi vill därför att du är noggrann.
   

  

 Vidare så händer det saker, nya behov kan uppstå varför det är viktig att du är flexibel. Vi kommer inom kort att implementera pm3 modellen för HR där du kommer vara en viktig spelare, så har du erfarenhet av förvaltningsmodeller är det meriterande.
   

  

 Vi arbetar kompetensbaserat i Järfälla kommun när det kommer till rekrytering, stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet och arbetspsykologiska tester kommer att genomföras i denna rekrytering.
   

  

 Har du frågor runt tjänsten svara vi gärna på dem efter den 12/8.
   

  

**Övrig information**
 Järfälla har norra Stockholms mest spännande geografiska läge och växer snabbt. Vi erbjuder en arbetsplats med stor variation, goda utvecklingsmöjligheter och arbetar efter visionen Järfälla för alla framåt.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss alla erbjudanden om annonserings- och rekryteringshjälp i samband med denna annons.

title: Researcher within automotive corrosion
description:
*Do you have experience in atmospheric corrosion in various applications? Do you enjoy working on both longer projects and short assignments, all of which focus on a demand-driven technology development linked to societal and industrial challenges in both Sweden and internationally? Do you see it as motivating to be able to take your own initiative to develop a segment, carry out research projects and customer assignments? Then RISE has an interesting job for you!*
**About Us**
 The Corrosion department of RISE offers an attractive workplace as one of Europe's leading corrosion research players with the mission to create Swedish industrial benefit through company-wide research. We are located in Kista north of Stockholm where we have large modern premises, as well as in Borås. In France, we have a wholly owned subsidiary focused on corrosion research.
   

  

**About The Position**
 You will be working as Researcher in the corrosion department. You will work in several projects related to automotive corrosion, surface treatment and corrosion testing. You will be working with a range of different research and development projects as well as carrying out shorter industrial consultancy projects regarding corrosion of metallic materials. You will work closely with our industrial clients as well as other research entities, in Sweden but also internationally. You will be given an independent role while being part of a research team with close collaboration with your colleagues.
   

  

 Placement: Kista
   

  

**Who are you?**
 You have a university degree within material science, chemistry or engineering. You have a good theoretical understanding as well as interest and comprehension for laboratory work. We prioritise our customers and colleagues, so you should have a good ability to create working relationships with both. The job involves a lot of customer contact and therefore demands that you can express yourself clearly in both Swedish and English, both speaking and writing.
   

  

 As a person you are committed and driven, enjoy a high tempo environment and see solutions and opportunities rather than problems. You are well organised and have an interest in helping create new business and projects but also an ability to further develop existing ones.
   

  

**Are we right for each other?**
 We can't promise you a simple job, but we can offer you many committed and enthusiastic colleagues and some exciting industrial and societal challenges. You will work in a dynamic environment that gives you development opportunities both professionally and personally. At RISE, we want you to succeed and feel good, because together with your colleagues you contribute to a sustainable future and to securing a leading position for Swedish industry and research globally.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 For more information about the position, please contact Johan Tidblad, Unit manager, tel: +46 73 512 56 82, johan.tidblad@ri.se. Please note that we do not accept applications by email. Last day to apply is 25th of August.
   

  

 Our union representative are Ulf Nordberg, SACO, 010-516 69 59 och Linda Ikatti, Unionen, 010-516 51 61.

title: ANAPLAN COE LEAD
description:
**Anaplan Center of Excellence (COE) Lead**
 Do you have a strong interest in enabling technology to improve business processes? Are you excited about air travel and becoming a key player in enterprise financial planning, supporting SAS's delivery of its strategy and business plan?
   

  

 SAS is in a very exciting period going through its biggest single financial restructuring in history. In 2023, a consortium of investors – the biggest being Castlelake, AirFrance/KLM, and the Danish State – agreed to provide the necessary funding, enabling SAS to proceed with completing the U.S. and Swedish legal processes.
   

  

 SAS Finance has an ambitious digitalization agenda going forward, to improve speed and agility on multiple dimensions. Our mission is to shift the perspective from reporting actuals to rolling forecasting on a granular level and up to several years in a more condensed, but still integrated planning. We will build a comprehensive capability to swiftly update our long-term financial plan and model various scenarios and outcomes. SAS has chosen Anaplan as an FP&A tool for these purposes.
   

  

 You will establish and lead SAS Anaplan COE with at least one additional Anaplan Builder in team. Your mission is to directly contribute to the ongoing development of Anaplan according to business requirements.
   

  

 This is a position located in our head office at Frösundavik, Solna.
   

  

**Main duties**
**COE establishment and project management**
* Establish and lead SAS Anaplan COE
* Manage projects by driving design sessions, gathering requirements, providing status updates, delivering solutions
* Maintain sprint plans, follow build standards, and track issues/requests


**Anaplan System development and administration**
* Understand business processes and business requirements
* Translate requirements into functional requirements and use cases, articulating solutions to the stakeholders as this role involves discussion at various levels with business stakeholders
* Design and build Anaplan application models to support business processes
* Build and develop Anaplan modules and list based on the model blueprint
* Configure and maintain Anaplan lists, modules, dashboards, actions, and other model settings to meet business needs
* Transform and implement multi-dimensional structures to support business processes
* Implement high-quality code using best practices
* Monitor data flows to and from the system to ensure all data is up-to-date and accurate
* Define and administer user roles and permissions in Anaplan


**System training and expertise**
* Maintain expert model-building skills in Anaplan and be the point person for functionality and data definition
* Primary contact for model troubleshooting and enhancement requests
* Grow superuser base and expand knowledge of Anaplan to the business
* Provide hands-on support/training to end users on Anaplan models and processes


**Your profile**
* Proven ability to successfully manage projects with multiple stakeholders involved
* Driven and self-going individual with proven strong ability to work independently with limited operative support
* Collaborative and data-driven problem-solver who value connections between facts, figures, strategies and people
* Ability to collaborate closely with all business controllers, the wider Finance community, Digital/IT and over time further business process owners across SAS as the Anaplan tool is rolled out to other departments
* Ability to dive into the details to convert business requirements to actionable items
* Possess business acumen, strong analytical, troubleshooting, problem-solving skills
* Organized and detail oriented
* Excellent communication skills, ability to explain and translate between technical and non-technical people
* Proven ability to work in a demanding, fast-paced environment and manage a high workload


**Your Knowledge And Qualifications**
* Strong expertise and deep understanding of multi-dimensional modeling
* Excel spreadsheet modeling, macros, pivot tables, formulas, charts etc.
* Subject matter expertise in Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
* Strong understanding of accounting fundamentals. P&L, BS, CF
* Experienced and established finance systems professional with hands on experience with Anaplan both functionally and technically
* Previous Anaplan COE Lead with team leadership experience highly valued
* Minimum of 4-5 years of experience as Anaplan Builder at either a larger complex corporation and/or consultancy firm specialized in Anaplan services and implementing full end-to-end projects in the past.
* In depth knowledge of the airline industry is a huge plus but not a requirement
* Bachelor or Master’s degree in a relevant field, e.g. Business Administration, Accounting, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, etc required
* Fluent in English, Swedish is a plus

title: Building Services Leader - Nordic and Baltic Zone
description:
Are you ready to take charge and drive success in Digital Energy within the Nordic Baltic Zone? We are searching for a passionate leader to inspire and guide our team, turning our vision into a shared mission. If you're excited about taking on this challenge and making a significant impact within Schneider Electric, we want to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of energy management and automation.
   

  

**What we offer you:**
 As a key member of our Nordic management team, reporting to the VP Digital Energy Nordic Baltic Zone, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the strategic direction of the services business in the region. Your focus will be on driving performance, providing support to countries, and leading future business development.
   

  

* Develop and implement the regional services strategy, concentrating on performance and future business development in alignment with company goals.
* Oversee the P&L of the services organization in the Nordic Baltic zone, emphasizing country support and operational excellence
* Prioritize customer satisfaction and loyalty through exceptional service delivery, strong customer connections, and initiatives that enhance customer retention.
* Drive operational efficiency by streamlining processes and resources, supporting countries to deliver services efficiently while maintaining high quality.
* Lead the development of a high-performing team of service professionals, setting performance objectives and nurturing a culture of high performance.


**What we are looking for:**
* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a relevant field.
* Experience in leadership within the services industry, focusing on aligning service strategies with company goals and driving operational excellence.
* Proven track record of effectively managing P&L, achieving financial goals, and fostering a culture of high performance within teams.
* Fluent in English; knowledge of any Nordic language is advantageous.


 We are seeking a candidate with strong business acumen, financial expertise, and strategic insight to drive performance, support countries, and shape future business development. If you possess outstanding interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills, along with analytical and problem-solving abilities, we'd like to hear from you.
   

  

 The application period is open until the
 **25th of August** 
 , and we will start reviewing candidates after the application period so don’t expect feedback prior to this date. We thank you for your patience.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 Please submit your application soonest. We will fulfill the position as soon as the suitable candidate has been found. Read more about our Digital Energy Business:
   

  

 https://www.se.com/ww/en/work/campaign/buildings-of-the-future/
   

  

**Why us?**
 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful** 
 purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.
   

  

 We believe in
 **e** 
**mpowering** 
 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.
   

  

 We embrace
 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Discover your
 **M** 
**eaningful, Inclusive** 
 and
 **Empowered** 
 career at Schneider Electric.
   

  

 €34.2bn global revenue
   

  

 +12% organic growth
   

  

 135 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

*Schneider Electric aspires*

This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.*
